text:
More US data disappointments today:
Consumer sentiment, per the University of Michigan’s measure, fell by 8 points -- more than expected and to its lowest level since the index started in 1952.
Also worrisome, long-term #inflation expectations rose to 3.3%, the highest since 2008

urls.description: Mohamed El-Erian, Allianz and Gramercy advisor and president of Queen’s College, Cambridge, joins CNBC's 'Squawk Box' to react to May's higher-than-expected ...
urls.title: Fed Chair Powell is 'losing total control' of inflation narrative, says Mohamed El-Erian
